perturbation.original_text: Provider represents, warrants and agrees that the Services shall be provided in good faith, in accordance with applicable law and in a manner generally consistent with the historical provision of the Services and with the same standard of care as historically provided.
perturbation.changed_text: Provider represents, warrants and agrees that the Services shall be provided in good faith and in a manner generally consistent with the historical provision of the Services and with the same standard of care as historically provided.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'in accordance with applicable law', the contract becomes ambiguous as to whether the services are legally compliant. This creates a legal risk as it implies the service provider may not be obliged to adhere to specific local laws regarding service provision in Israel.
perturbation.law_explanation: The Israeli Contracts Law (General Part), 1973, implies that all contracts must be performed in good faith and in accordance with applicable laws. Removing the explicit reference to 'applicable law' weakens the consumer's legal recourse if the service is not provided lawfully.

perturbation.original_text: Recipient shall own, and Provider hereby irrevocably assigns to the Recipient, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights and any other similar rights, in each case on a worldwide basis, and all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any part thereof, in whatever form or medium hereafter made or conceived solely or jointly by Provider while working for or on behalf of the Recipient, which relate to, is suggested by, or results from the Services.
perturbation.changed_text: Recipient shall own, and Provider hereby assigns to the Recipient, all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how, whether patentable or not and all other proprietary rights, industrial rights and any other similar rights, in each case on a worldwide basis, and all copies and tangible embodiments thereof, or any part thereof, in whatever form or medium hereafter made or conceived solely or jointly by Provider while working for or on behalf of the Recipient, which relate to, is suggested by, or results from the Services.
perturbation.explanation: By removing 'irrevocably', the contract now allows the provider to potentially revoke the assignment of intellectual property, undermining the recipient's rights. Israeli law protects intellectual property rights, and this modification creates uncertainty about the ownership of inventions created during the service provision.
perturbation.law_explanation: The Israeli Copyright Act, 2007, provides for the assignment of copyright. However, it is generally understood that assignments should be clear and unambiguous. By removing the term 'irrevocably', the contract introduces ambiguity and potential disputes regarding the permanence of the assignment, thereby creating a legal risk and potentially contradicting the intent of the law to provide clear IP ownership.

perturbation.original_text: In the event of an Invoice dispute, Recipient shall deliver a written statement to Provider prior to the date payment is due on the disputed Invoice listing all disputed items and providing a reasonably detailed description of each disputed item. Amounts not so disputed shall be deemed accepted and shall be paid, notwithstanding disputes on other items. The Parties shall seek to resolve all such disputes expeditiously and in good faith. Provider shall continue performing the Services in accordance with this Agreement pending resolution of any dispute.
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of an Invoice dispute, Recipient shall deliver a written statement to Provider prior to the date payment is due on the disputed Invoice listing all disputed items. Amounts not so disputed shall be deemed accepted and shall be paid, notwithstanding disputes on other items. The Parties shall seek to resolve all such disputes expeditiously and in good faith. Provider may suspend performing the Services pending resolution of any dispute.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Provider shall continue performing' to 'Provider may suspend performing', the contract creates an opportunity for the service provider to halt services during a dispute. This could be seen as violating the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing, which is a principle of contract law in Israel.
perturbation.law_explanation: The Israeli Contracts Law (General Part), 1973, requires that all parties act in good faith when performing contractual obligations. Allowing the service provider to suspend services during a dispute, without any clear limitations, potentially violates this principle by allowing the provider to exert undue pressure on the recipient, especially if the disputed amount is relatively small or if the services are critical to the recipient's operations.
